summary: AI-Assisted Construction Progress Monitoring System - A professional dashboard UI for a Final Year Engineering Project that allows government agencies to monitor building construction progress through uploaded site images. Features include login, main dashboard with project statistics, upload progress form with drag-and-drop, and detailed project view with progress tracking and image comparison. Built with React and Tailwind CSS in a clean government/enterprise style using deep blue and gray colors.
architectural_notes: React functional components with Tailwind CSS for styling
Component-based architecture with reusable UI elements (Card, Button, Alert, Sidebar)
No backend integration - UI only with mock data for tables and charts
Government/enterprise style: deep blue primary, gray secondary, light theme
Construction stages: Foundation, Superstructure, Facade, Interiors, Furnishing
Drag-and-drop image upload functionality in Upload Progress form
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Professional government building construction site photo for dashboard hero section (construction-site-hero.dim_1200x600.png)
- Construction foundation stage reference image for comparison section (foundation-stage.dim_400x300.png)
- Construction superstructure stage reference image for comparison section (superstructure-stage.dim_400x300.png)
- Modern office building under construction for project gallery (building-progress-1.dim_400x300.png)
- High-rise construction progress photo for project gallery (building-progress-2.dim_400x300.png)
- Infrastructure construction site aerial view for project gallery (building-progress-3.dim_400x300.png)

existing_features.title: Create a Login page with centered card layout containing email field, password field, and login button. Style with deep blue primary color and gray secondary color using Tailwind CSS.

Create a Dashboard page with sidebar navigation (Dashboard, Upload Progress, Projects, Logout), top navbar displaying 'AI-Assisted Construction Progress Monitoring System', and three statistics cards showing Total Projects, Active Projects, and Last Updated Project. Use card-based layout with deep blue and gray color scheme.
Add a projects table to the Dashboard page displaying Project Name, Stage, Progress %, Last Updated Date, and a View Details button for each row. Use mock data for the table entries.

Create an Upload Progress page with a form card containing: Project dropdown selector, Number of Buildings input field, Construction Stage dropdown (Foundation, Superstructure, Facade, Interiors, Furnishing), and a drag-and-drop style image upload box. Include Submit button, error alert UI component, and success notification component.

Create a Project Details page displaying: project name header, current stage badge, large progress percentage display, progress bar, timeline graph placeholder (Recharts compatible structure), image history gallery, and a comparison section showing Previous Stage, Current Stage, and Progress Increase percentage. Use mock data throughout.

Organize all React components in a structured folder hierarchy with clean, readable code. Use functional components throughout and ensure responsive design across all pages using Tailwind CSS mobile-first approach.

new_feature_requests.summary: Login page with email/password fields and centered card layout
Dashboard page with sidebar navigation, top navbar, project statistics cards (Total/Active/Last Updated), and projects table with view details
Upload Progress page with form for project selection, building count, construction stage dropdown, and drag-and-drop image upload
Project Details page with stage badge, progress display, timeline graph placeholder, image history gallery, and stage comparison section
Reusable components: Card, Button, Alert, responsive Sidebar with Tailwind CSS styling

Create reusable components: Card component for content containers, Button component with primary/secondary variants, Alert component for error/success messages, and responsive Sidebar component. All components should use Tailwind CSS with deep blue primary color, gray secondary color, modern rounded corners, and soft shadows.
